I'm not a fan of badges. They stick their nose in other people's biz, give ordinary people a hard time, do the corps' bidding. But sometimes it's worth getting into bed with your enemies – at least they'll owe you something for later.

There's this badge, Jasmine Dixon. She's been patrolling NC streets since '61, reached the rank of sergeant. One day at the precinct she heard something she shouldn't've. Instead of keeping her mouth shut, she took it to her supervisor. The next day they wheeled her off to a psych ward. The kind where they prescribe lobotomies and electrotherapy.

Her husband will do anything to help her and as far as payment goes, "anything" is as good as it gets. You'll get your standard rate, of course. So, whaddya say? Gotta help a couple in need, don't you think?

objectives.description: Escort Jasmine Dixon to the transport.
Escort Jasmine Dixon out of the hospital.

title: Gig: Going-away Party
description:
Gig type: SOS: Merc Needed
Objective: Rescue Flavio dos Santos
Location: Mallagra St.
Details:

6th Street got shaken up with an internal coup, the boss took a bullet in the back of the head. The guy who filled his shoes was the same who pulled the trigger – they call him Gunner.  The new bossman has unleashed a purge to rid the gang of all the people loyal to the last chief. My client, Flavio, is next in line to get shot and he'd very much like to skip town.

Already struck a deal with the nomads who agreed to ship him to the other coast. All you have to do is escort Flavio to the place their guide will pick him up. Little problem to note: there's already a price on our friend's head, so he's gotta watch it.

Sending you coords of where Flavio's holed up. You need to get there, load him into your ride, and deliver to the nomads ASAP. Keep your iron at the ready and don't forget to always check your mirrors. 6th St gave him a death sentence so any tails on his ass are likely to be hot.

objectives.description: Find out what happened to Flavio.
Enter Flavio's hideout and find out what happened.
Find Flavio dos Santos in his hideout.
Go and get Flavio from the hideout.
Get in the car with Flavio.
Bring Flavio to the nomad contact.
Scan the bodies to find Flavio.

title: Gig: Error 404
description:
Gig type: Agent Saboteur
Objective: Bring down propaganda machine slandering Weldon Holt
Location: Garage on Oak St.
Details:

Politics. Only thing slimier than the thongs at Licks. At least corpos usually tell you to your face how they're gonna screw you in the end. Fake smiles, impossible promises, shameless pandering – all foreplay till they fuck you in the ass and pay themselves for it with eddies outta your wallet. It's in their nature. And what's in ours? Blowing shit up. Got just such a gig for you this time.

6th Street's got a stiffy for Jefferson Peralez so they have these servers pumping out anti-Holt propaganda. They see Peralez becoming mayor as like the second coming of Abraham Lincoln or some shit, here to unite the city with the NUSA. Naive gonks.

TL;DR – My client wants 6th Street's propaganda machine gone. Simple.

objectives.description: Find the garage with the servers.

title: Gig: Family Matters
description:
Gig type: Search and Recover
Objective: Retrieve the Zetatech data Juliet Horrigan owes El Capitán
Location: House on Gibson St.
Details:

I like everyone to know I'm patient, understanding. I realize there's a time for work and a time for family. Without a good work-life balance we'd all blast our brains out. I get it, I do. But... disappearing for 2 weeks cuz of "family issues?" That how Juliet thinks of me? How much she respects me? I love her cuz she's ripped so much nova data outta Zetatech for me, but man she's starting to hurt my feelings, you know?

Go to her place, see what her deal is. But remember – #1 priority is that data she still owes me. Juliet's nova and all, but if she's got a problem with that, well... like I said, data is prio #1.

objectives.description: Deposit the datashard in the Drop Point.
Find a way to open the safe.
Get the chip from Juliet's home.
Take the chip from the safe.
Find out what happened to Juliet.

title: Ride Captain Ride
description: Phew. Glad to hear your business in Santo Domingo is finally over. You did what you could – the junkies will keep shooting up, the 6th Street pricks will wave their flags, and all the young punks growing up there will go down one of those two paths. But you've changed the place for the better, if only slightly. Cast a ray of sunlight into a godforsaken cesspit, so to speak. Helping El Capitan was the right call – he gained more control over Santo Domingo, and now he wants to throw in something extra for your efforts digging through all the waste. Guy knows how to reward his flunkies, that's for sure.

title: Gig: Concrete Cage Trap
description:
Gig type: SOS: Merc Needed
Objective: Rescue Tiny Mike from the Militech raid
Location: Residence building at the corner of Cortes and Kennedy
Details:

Tiny Mike's got himself in a scrape. You help him today, he helps you tomorrow – you know how it works.

I sent Tiny to klep some files from a Militech facility yesterday and clearly it didn't go as planned (mostly). Tiny swiped the data but Militech tracked the hack and has him cornered. You don't like sad endings do you? Let's try to avoid one here.

Tiny's hunkered down in our safehouse – apartment 63 at a residential block in north Kabuki. Militech's got him pinned inside and surrounded. Armored vehicles, heavy-ironed corpsec troops, the whole thing, probably the fucking spanish armada too. Break through their lines and save my man.

And don't worry – this isn't a charity case.
I’m attaching something that will help you recognize him.

objectives.description: Escort Tiny Mike to the fixer's transport.
Lead Tiny Mike to the restaurant.
Get in the car with Tiny Mike.
Escort Tiny Mike out of the lockdown area.
Give the inhaler to Tiny Mike.
Take the inhaler from Tiny Mike's backpack.

title: Gig: Hippocratic Oath
description:
Gig type: SOS: Merc Needed
Objective: Rescue Lucy Thackery from Maelstrom captivity
Location: Clean Cut clinic on Longshore North St.
Details:

Blood looks out for blood. Bertie's a leadhead who was gonk enough to join up with Maelstrom. Realized pretty quick the psychogang operates by simple rules – you stay, you die, or you pay.

In comes his sister, Lucy, who chose option number three. Instead of hard scratch, she bought out her bro's freedom with her expertise and services. She put 3 months of cyberware repair on the table. Problem is, five months have already come and gone.

Now in comes you. This gig's on Bertie's dime – guess he had a few extra eddies stuffed in his mattress.

objectives.description: Escort Lucy to the fixer's transport.
Go to the Clean Cut building.
Inject the patient with synthetic blood.

title: Gig: Backs Against the Wall
description:
Gig type: Search and Recover
Objective: Recovered stolen medicine
Location: Housing block on Columbus St.
Details:

A few years back I scrolled a little feature called "How Affordable is Health?" It turns out not very. My numbers showed only 3 percent of Night Citizens could afford healthcare. A lot has changed since. For the worse. Some people are declaring open war on rippers, breaking into clinics, klepping meds and chems. No surprise there. And no surprise these rippers want to protect what's theirs.

They want you to recover a pack of stolen meds. Thanks to the GPS tracer hidden inside, we know exactly where to look.

objectives.description: Deposit the medicine in the Drop Point.

title: Gig: Fixer, Merc, Soldier, Spy
description:
Gig type: Thievery
Objective: Steal Mikhail Akulov's datashard
Location: Hotel Raito on Adam St.
Details:

Remember the job with Mikhail Akulov's car that you royally botched? I hope so, cuz this time you're going to make up for it. In case your memory needs refreshing, Akulov is a top-tier soviet fixer who's in NC to cut some deal with Arasaka. Go to our dear comrade's hotel and klep his datashard. comrade.

The shard supposedly contains extremely valuable intel on talks with the Japanese. My client wants that shard.

As if it needs to be said, but he'll have heavy protection. And remember I'll pay extra if you do this on the hush.

Call me when it's done.

objectives.description: Deliver the shard to Regina's client.
Collect your bonus from the Drop Point.

title: Gig: Last Login
description:
Gig type: Thievery
Objective: Steal Alois Daquin's laptop
Location: Housing block on Eisenhower St.
Details:

Alois Daquin – the corpo megaprick who cheated me. And not only me. There's a whole city out there that wants to get its hands on this guy. As they say, the fate of a traitor is sealed at the time of his betrayal.

But what interests me beyond my vengeance is Alois' datapad and, well, the data on it. Our traitor picked up and fucked off right outta NC so fast he left his gear in town.

Just 20 min. ago I got a login ping from his comp on an Eisenhower St. localnet.

Head over there and grab his device. Once we get it, we take advantage of this confused mess.

objectives.description: Enter the building where Alois' laptop was connected to the Net.
Deposit the laptop in the Drop Point.

title: Gig: Shark in the Water
description:
Gig type: Gun for Hire
Target: Blake Croyle
Location: Aoba on O'Malley Place St.
Details:

Racketeering's the name of the game in Kabuki. The badges pretend like they don't see when hustlers like Blake reel in the next victim.

The script's always the same. Act I – a promising money deal. Act II – an unpayable debt. The sucker this time was Roger Wang, store chain owner. Blake's already seized ownership of one of the stores but has bigger plans. Like I said, this kind of debt's unpayable, so Wang got wise and paid us instead. This human shitstain Croyle is about to disappear, so the time to act is now.

And one more thing – Blake's got huscle from the Animals watching his back.

objectives.description: Put Blake in the fixer's transport.
Go to the store seized by Blake.
Carry Blake to the fixer's transport.

title: Gig: Monster Hunt
description:
Gig type: Gun for Hire
Target: Jotaro Shobo (age 44, Japanese-American)
Location: Ho-Oh club on Allen St.
Details:

Feel like doing everyone a favor and making eddies doing it? Deal with Jotaro Shobo. Twisted motherfucker like no other.

He's a Tyger Claw and a sadistic scumbag who's got a thing for scrolling XBDs. Who's to say whether he just gets carried away or (and my money's on this) he gets off on the tortured screams of his victims. Best guess is seventeen murders to his name, but the (in)justice for the street's dead and missing joytoys is notorious.

But the Moxes are different.

Mox netrunners connected a few dots and tracked down Jotaro's studio – Ho-Oh – quaint little club in Kabuki. This area's a no-go for Moxes which is why they need a helping hand.

Find this fucker Jotaro and tell him his days in the entertainment biz are done.

objectives.description: Carry Jotaro to the fixer's transport.
Collect your bonus from the Drop Point.
Take Jotaro's body and leave the area.

title: Gig: Woman of La Mancha
description:
Gig type: Gun for Hire
Objective: Force Anna Hamill to drop her police investigation
Location: Kabuki market
Details:

Anna Hamill is a blue-blooded cop, through and through. The kind you'd expect to see in some NCPD promo. Beautiful, smart, honest to a fault. In other words, a really bad fit for Night City.

Her NCPD colleagues are another story. They all have back problems from sitting on fat wallets.

This current case Hamill's working has them all breaking out in hives. She's digging into the smuggling racket in Kabuki market, which – if she makes any real headway – means bad biz for her cop buddies' finances. They want someone from outside the precinct to nip this thing in the bud.

Normally that's where I'd leave it, but I wanna add one more thing. I kinda feel bad for the girl. Rather she not flatline if you can avoid it. Convince her to skip town, or drop the case and make a career change at least.

objectives.description: Carry Anna Hamill to the fixer's car.
Upload the program to the marketplace network.

Typ kontraktu: Neutralizacja
Cel: Zmuś Annę Hammil do przerwania śledztwa
Lokalizacja: okolice bazarau Kabuki
Szczegóły:


Anna Hammil, to policjantka jakby wyjęta z filmu promującego Akademię Policyjną. Piękna, mądra i niezwykle uczciwa. Mówiąc inaczej, nie nadaje się do pracy w Night City.


Co innego jej koledzy z NPCD. Oni od siedzenia na grubych portfelach dostali skrzywienia kręgosłupa. Tego moralnego.


Teraz boli ich, że Anna prowadzi śledztwo w sprawie nielegalnego obrotu wszczepami na bazarze w Kabuki. Wynik  śledztwa mógłby źle wpłynąć na ich finanse, dlatego chcą by Anna je przerwała.


Powiem tak. Normalnie nie zleciłabym ci tej roboty, ale po prostu szkoda mi tej dziewczyny. Spróbuj ją przekonać, żeby rzuciła ten syf i zmieniła towarzystwo.
Carry Anna Hamill out of the bazaar.

title: Gig: Small Man, Big Evil
description:
Gig type: Gun for Hire
Target: Jae-Hyun
Location: Rooftop slums near Allen St.
Details:

Countless dreamers head to big cities in search of a fresh start. And so many of them have nowhere to return to. Outcasts, loners, rejects. Jae-Hyun's put a targets on the backs of those society's failed. And there's no shortage of them in Night City.

Here's the rundown on Jae-Hyun's meat grinder: he identifies some poor bastard, kidnaps them, and delivers them to scavs for biomon or other cyberware removal. They're stripped of their identities and end up the "property" of some shitbag like Jotaro to do with as they please.

Course no one really looks for these people. And even if they did where would they start? What are the odds? To find someone in Night City who doesn't exist?

Let's face it – Jae-Hyun is just one head of the hydra, but fuck it – let's chop it off anyway. Could be a good while before more grow back in his place.

objectives.description: Carry the body to the fixer's vehicle.
Find Jae-Hyun in the restricted part of the slums.
Pick up Jae-Hyun and leave the area.

title: Gig: Welcome to America, Comrade
description:
Gig type: Agent Saboteur
Objective: Place GPS tracker on Mikhail Akulov's car
Location: Kabuki port
Details:
When a top Soviet fixer, Mikhail Akulov, landed in NC, it generated a lot of buzz in the biz. So far, says he's just in town to cut a small-time deal. The USSR's premier fixer in town to personally handle minor league gigs at enny stakes? Yeah, can't say I'm convinced either
So what's his game? Why Night City? My client needs answers to these questions and more. They want to follow his every step on NC soil and that's why you need to plant a GPS transmitter on our dear comrade's car. And keep it clean and quiet.

objectives.description: Find the container with the vehicle.
Collect your bonus from the Drop Point.
Go to the docks in Kabuki.
Plant the GPS tracker on the vehicle.

title: Gig: Troublesome Neighbors
description:
Gig type: Gun for Hire
Target: Taki Kenmochi
Location: Residence building at Cortes and Kennedy St.
Details:

I got a place at this block in Kabuki. Not many know about it (welcome to the club) and I prefer to keep it that way. Problem is a certain Tyger Cunt (and friends) set up a pachinko operation right on my fucking doorstep. Could mean trouble for me down the road.

Lemme guess – you're thinking it's better to hide in plain sight? Yeah, fuck that. When (not if) the NCPD cracks down on those pachinko machines, I know they're gonna poke their ugly pig noses around in my backyard. Can't risk them seeing something they shouldn't.

We can't sit on this. Head to the residential block where a Tyger by name of Taki Kenmochi is running this pachinko show. Deal with her. Any other Tygers in the area will get the message and peace out quick.

objectives.description: Carry Taki Kenmochi to the fixer's transport.
Move away from the pachinko machines.
Pick up Taki Kenmochi and leave the area.

title: Gig: Catch a Tyger's Toe
description:
Gig type: Agent Saboteur
Objective: Upload b@d's malware
Location: Megabuilding H11
Details:

b@d got in touch with me. They like short nicknames and simple gigs, so I'll spare you the fixer spiel and get right to the point.

You'll find b@d's malware attached to this message. You have to download it (just be careful – it's hella dangerous) and then upload it to the subnet in the H11 megabuilding. Piece o' cake, right? Sorry to burst your bubble, but you'll have Tygers on the prowl.

b@d's plan is to attack some Arasaka subnet and use H11 as a smokescreen. Clever, right? Instead of leading to them, all traces of b@d's breach'll lead right back to the megabuilding.

FYI, our netrunner already hacked the megabuilding elevator, so getting into the server room won't be a problem.

objectives.description: Upload b@d's malware to the system.

title: Gig: Bloodsport
description:
Gig type: SOS: Merc Needed
Objective: Roh Chi-Won
Location: Tyger Claws dojo on Brookland St.
Details:

Matter's urgent. My client, Macidew Coolidge (you might recognize him from his show,"Boxathon," on N54 from a few years back) is looking for someone to get his coach back from the Tyger Claws.

Here's the deal. Macidew got himself into a debt hole. Looking to climb out the easy way, he cut a deal with the Tygers. They gave him a wad of cash to go down in the next fight. And what did he do with it? He goes to the bookie incognito and bets on his own win. Next thing you know, he KO's his opponent in the second round and blasts off into the sunset in an AV.

It was happily ever after for Macidew, until they kidnapped his coach, Roh Chi-Won. They're threatening to kill him if Macidew doesn't come back to Night City. Macidew doesn't want his coach's death to weigh on his conscience, so he got in touch with me and I got in touch with you. Sending you the coords for where they're keeping Roh Chi-Won. Try getting to him without tripping the alarm. Hostages and shootouts don't mix well. Good luck.

objectives.description: Escort Roh to the fixer's transport.
Go to the Tyger Claws' dojo.
Find out where Roh is being held.

title: Gig: Playing for Keeps
description:
Gig type: Search and Recover
Objective: Jacob Lamb's implant
Location: Kashuu Hanten Bar, Clarendon St.
Details:

Got a call from Jacob Lamb – friend of mine, director, from the good ol' days. Ex-director, I should say. Ever since Bushido X made a loss of a billion, the guy never set foot on a set again.

Jacob makes a living playing cards. One time he tried his luck at an illegal Tyger Claws casino at the back of the Kashuu Hanten eatery. Things weren't looking good, but instead of getting up from the table, he waited until he'd recoup. First went all his money, then his watch, wedding ring... And finally, one of his optics.

Jacob wants his implant back. Sending you the coordinates of the casino where he lost it. AFAIK, the eye's still there. How you get it is your biz, not mine.

objectives.description: Deposit the implant in the Drop Point.
Wait for the bartender to bring the implant.
Blackmail the bartender to give you the implant.
Go to the Kashuu Hanten bar in Little China.
Take the optic implant from the storage room.

title: Gig: The Heisenberg Principle
description:
Gig type: Agent Saboteur
Objective: Destroy the glitter lab
Location: Building on Rovinj St.
Details

Unless you've been living under a rock, you've heard of Glitter. Word is that if you take it, you're hooked for life, but apparently it's easier to OD on than neo-fentanyl.

It was only a matter of time before some zit-faced, rich kid fried his skull sponge. Kid's mother was Arati Kapoor, co-owner of the Masala Studios restaurant franchise. Needless to say, she's pretty torn up about it, but she's not the kind to wallow in her grief – she's got a plan.

The lab where glitter is cooked has to be wiped off the face of the earth. And if some of those dipshits making it expire on the spot? I think you know the answer.

Flicking you the coords now. FYI – the place might be guarded by Tyger Claws.

objectives.description: Destroy the equipment used to make glitter.

title: Gig: Occupational Hazard
description:
Gig type: SOS: Merc Needed
Target: Hal Cantos
Location: Mox warehouse on Longshore North
Details:

Got a call from a Hal Cantos – guy's a known quantity in the area, crack BD tuner, used to work for WNS news 'til he got axed for fraud. His biz is strictly street now. Like it even matters...

Hal's got himself in an interesting sich. He was tuning a BD for The Mox and must've fucked up, 'cause one of the girls went off the handle after she put on the wreath – started screaming and shooting at everything that moved. Hal managed to find a place to hide, but it's only a matter of time before she gets him. You're gonna make sure that doesn't happen.

Sending you the warehouse coordinates where Hal's holed up. Again, in case you missed it, there's an ACTIVE SHOOTER in the building. Go in with your iron at the ready. Eddies'll reach you only if Hal makes it out alive.

objectives.description: Hack into the Moxes' subnet to weaken the cyberpsycho.

title: Gig: Many Ways to Skin a Cat
description:
Gig type: Thievery
Objective: Steal a Revere Courier Services van
Location: Revere Courier Services warehouse on Martin St
Details:

This isn't gonna be your usual gig. You're gonna go to the Revere Courier Services facility in Northside and steal a minibus full of leather jackets.

Don't worry, I was also scratching my head at first. But the job itself couldn't be simpler.

Someone's smuggling syn-leather combat jackets to NC to get around the corporate embargo. The leather's imported in the form of jackets, which is then distributed to underground ripperdoc that use them for their implants, which are then sold at competitive prices. Quite a supply chain, right? My client tracked down the shipment but can't take care of it on her own. You're her replacement. Just remember that the RCS can't roll until it validates the driver's identity.
Oh and did I mention that the RCS warehouse is controlled by the Tyger Claws? No? Well I'm telling you now. They use it for laundering cash, so don't be surprised to see them prowling around.
Be careful and good luck.

objectives.description: Drive the van to the indicated location.
Gain access to the van using the main computer.
Collect your reward from the Drop Point.
Go to the Revere Courier Services facility.

title: Gig: Flight of the Cheetah
description:
Gig type: SOS: Merc Needed
Target: Hwangbo
Location: Motel on Martin St.
Details:

You know that classic comedy setup where a gonk gets into serious trouble and only some, like, misanthropic hardass can save him? Well, let that be your guiding plot for today.

The gonk in question is called Hwangbo. He did some small-time work for the Tyger Claws, but instead of keeping his head down and being patient, he took a shortcut and stole from his own gang. Genius, right? Not only that, but the whole thing had his name written all over it.

Hwangbo's marked for death, meaning he has to disappear – the faster, the better. I already found a nomad smuggler, but someone still needs to get him from one end of the city to the other. But if he's spotted out on the street, the Tyger Claws'll know about it. You know what you gotta do, right? So let's get to it. He's holed up somewhere in the motel on Martin.

objectives.description: Escort Hwangbo to the meeting with the nomads.

title: Gig: Dirty Biz
description:
Gig type: Thievery
Objective: Get the raw BD of the murder of Bryce Stone's son
Location: Buildings off Shipyard Way
Details:

My good friend, the televangelist Bryce Stone (don't ask, it's complicated) needs our help. His little boy was kidnapped and brutally murdered a few days later. The NCPD dropped the case due to lack of evidence. Bryce decided to take matters into his own hands and found the BD scroll of his murder, but the virtu's heavily edited, meaning there aren't a lot of clues to go on. If you could get your hands on the raw cut there's a chance we could identify the murderer.

The virtu was put out by two XBD tuners (Gottfrid and Fredrik) in Northside. I'm betting they still have the original somewhere. Just watch out for the Maelstromers that are guarding them.

objectives.description: Deposit the recording in the Drop Point.

Contract type Retrieving
Goal Get an original recording of a black BD of a murder
Clients dossier Bryce Stone, televangelist from NEWS54
Location Docks in Northside Industrial District
Details Client's son was murdered. Guy who murdered his son recorded everything on a braindance. My intel tells me that recording is currently in the hands of Gottfrid&Frederik - creators of The Shuttle Dock - one of the most famous BD sharing site - and BD dealers as well. You have to go to these two guys and take the original version of Braindance from them - using the original recording televangelist will be able to analyze the crime and find the murderer.

title: Gig: Rite of Passage
description:
Gig type: Thievery
Objective: Steal a recording of Maelstrom's initiation rite
Location: Daniels St.
Details:

Got some paparazzo work for ya. Need to get my hands on a recording of the Maelstrom initiation "ceremony." TLDR to get into the gang you need undergo an optic nerve split operation – a rite of passage, of sorts. Footage of the whole thing, that's what I'm paying for.

Got a tip you can find just such a reel at the HeavenMed clinic – it's the place they put all the new recruits under the knife for the first time. Op rooms are all fitted with cams too. Could be a file, an entire disk, access to the servers – I don't care. What matters is that footage. Get it done.

objectives.description: Go to the Maelstrom ripperdoc clinic.

title: Gig: Lousy Kleppers
description:
Gig type: Thievery
Objective: Steal the databank with the transport route data from Malorian Ltd.
Location: Warehouse, Offshore St.
Details:

V, big news going around town. A Malorian van was stolen on Sir Francis Drake avenue. Maelstrom claimed responsibility.

It just so happens that one of my informants saw the whole thing, and he was smart enough to tail them using a drone.

Hard part's over – we already know where they've stashed the van. I'd say we got lucky, but the truth is my people know how to get shit done. OK, OK, I'll quit flattering myself.

Go to the chop shop and find a databank in the van that has Malorian's transport route data. The gangers have no idea it's worth more than the all the cargo they're sitting on.

objectives.description: Deposit the databank in the Drop Point.
Find the databank from the Malorian van.

title: Gig: Scrolls before Swine
description:
Gig type: Thievery
Target: CCTV footage
Location: Maelstrom warehouse on the corner of Industrial and Eisenhower St.
Details:

Client is Aaron McCarlson, NCPD sergeant. Used to work for me as a consultant on the show "Cops 'n' Chops" (8 seasons!!) and is asking for a favor.

Aaron's been digging into Maelstrom for a while now – says he found the warehouse where they torture people. But you know how it is for badges – law slows them down with mountains of paperwork, so if they want to get something done, they have to get creative. Aaron knows that, which is why instead of waiting for fat-assed judges to grant him permission, he wants to get help from a "contractor."

Job's simple. Get into warehouse (coordinates attached), steal the security cam footage and bring it back to Aaron. Should be enough to push his case through. And if you happen to shoot a few Maelstromers along the way, well... shit happens, right? World won't be worse off without them, that's for sure.

objectives.description: Find the computer with the footage.
Tell Aaron you know what he did.

title: Gig: Freedom of the Press
description:
Gig type: SOS: Merc Needed
Objective: Rescue Max and bring him to me
Location: the old broadcast TV in Northside
Details:

Night City doesn't like people that like to kick the hornet's nest, and Max Jones... well, he kicked a bunch of 'em at the same time. Kicked them so hard, in fact, that someone put a hit out on him. Thing is, personally, I'd rather he stayed alive.

Max Jones is an old friend from my muckraking days. We co-wrote a vidcast about independent farmers who were put out of biz by Biotechnica drones. Those were the days.

Nowadays, Max doesn't even take my calls. He's as stubborn as they come, but now I'm worried he's really lost touch with reality. He probably thinks he can manage perfectly fine on his own, but that's what all young, gonk men think – that they're invincible. Bring him to reason, will ya?

Sending you the coords to his hideout. If I managed to track him down, it's only a matter of time until the others do too.

objectives.description: Convince Max to meet with Regina.
Persuade or force Max Jones to meet with Regina.

title: Last Call
description: Finally. No more calls, no more Watson gigs. That's great. Has anything changed? Not really, if you ask me. Watson's like a feral dog – many have tried to tame and treat it, but all they got is scars and a few bad memories. You went into dark alleys, clashed with some gangoons, got shot at a few times and for what? All you did is diluted the shit that's covering this entire neighborhood. You know that as well as Regina does. Nothing ever changes here. But hey, at least you tried, right? You completed all the assignments – let's celebrate a bit! And Regina won't let you leave empty-handed. Something to remember her by.

title: Gig: Until Death Do Us Part
description:
Gig type: Thievery
Objective: Steal the shard with Emilio Gutierrez's depository receipts
Location: Apartment on Palm St.
Details:

Would you like to hear about my fourth husband? He was very lazy, gullible, and filthy rich. I divorced him as quickly as I could and never made so much money in such a short time. With that said, can I really blame Mrs. Gutierrez for stripping Mr. Gutierrez down to the last enny? Of course not. In fact, I'd like to meet her lawyers.

But enough about Mrs. Gutierrez. Our client happens to be the injured party, Mr. Gutierrez. He lost his car and luxury penthouse, now the poor fool has barely anything to live in because he left his depository receipts in their old apartment (the locks are already changed). You'll have to retrieve them, because our new divorcee isn't going to give them back out of the kindness of her heart.

The penthouse is on the last floor of the building. Don't worry, I'm providing you with elevator access.

For obvious reasons, Mr. Gutierrez is counting on your utmost discretion. If things go quietly, he'll toss in extra.

objectives.description: Deposit the shard in the Drop Point.
Go to the apartment on Palm Street.
Steal the shard with the depository receipts.

title: Gig: Family Heirloom
description:
Gig type: Search and Recover
Objective: Rare, bootleg Samurai recording
Location: Parking lot on Crockett St.
Details:

There's this old saying – if it wasn't for fools, there would be no sages. The same is true for fixers.

The fool who needs your help is a man named Dan. Dan has a gambling problem – lately he managed to lose his car in a game of cards. To tell the truth, the ride's no great loss or anything – this guy isn't short on cars. What was valuable, however, was the one-of-a-kind bootleg Samurai recording stowed in the trunk. How did our fool come into possession of it, you ask? Well, he's Nancy's son. The same Nancy who played keyboard for the band, in the days when that snot-nosed boy used to call me "aunty."

You'll get that album for me. Gut tells me they haven't pawned it off just yet, it's probably still stashed somewhere around the place. And if you can swing it, grab Dan's car too for a little bonus. I'll snap you the coordinates of the guy holding the goods. And be aware, he licks the boots of the 6th Street Gang, so expect to deal with another fool. A stubborn one.

objectives.description: Find the bootleg recording of Samurai.
Collect your reward from Drop Point.
Retrieve the bootleg recording of Samurai.

title: Gig: Tyger and Vulture
description:
Gig type: Thievery
Objective: Steal Vortex's credchip
Location: Tyger Claws' casino on Longshore South
Details:

The vulture is the wisest bird. While others lose strength in the pursuit of prey, the vulture waits patiently – it only spreads its wings when it smells blood on the air.

You will be my vulture, V. I heard a Tyger Claws casino has been robbed by one of their own – a dealer. The girl had an alias, Vortex, and she managed the casino's machines. She programmed them to skim a small percentage so a drop from each win landed in her bucket. It took years for the Tygers to realize how they were being cheated. You can imagine they were not pleased. But their ferocity extended too far. Vortex died during the interrogation before revealing where she stored the stolen money. A vulture is wiser than a Tyger, V. You will find it.

I will send you the Vortex's last known location. Don't let me down.

objectives.description: Deposit Vortex's credchip in the Drop Point.
Find the office on the second floor.

title: Gig: Olive Branch
description:
Gig type: Special Delivery
Objective: Meet with Sergei Karasinsky and deliver his gift to the designated address
Location: Garage on Redwood St.
Details:

Sergei Karasinsky called. He's a solo who, like my husband, acts before he thinks. It's a personal characteristic that always leads to the same thing sooner or later – trouble. Fortunately for us, Sergei is not only a man who acts without thinking but a panicked one at that. This means the pay is good and almost literally flying out of his account into ours.

Sergei is waiting for you at Silk Road. You will meet him there and pick up the peace offering he would like delivered to the Tyger Claws. He can't do this himself because he's recently been added to their blacklist.

The boy believes this small token will help the Tygers find forgiveness in their hearts for his terrible mistake.

objectives.description: Defeat the Tyger Claws in the diner.
Meet Sergei at the designated location.
Open the trunk of Sergei's car.
Park in the back of Tyger Claws' diner.
Talk to the man in the trunk.
Drive Sergei's car to the Tyger Claws' restaurant.
Talk to the Tyger Claws leader.
Talk to the man in the trunk.

title: Gig: We Have Your Wife
description:
Gig type: SOS: Merc Needed
Objective: Rescue Lauren Costigan from the Tyger Claws
Location: Building by Raymond St.
Details:

Old sins cast long shadows. And Bradley Costigan is guilty of many. As a result, he not only found himself in prison, but also invited trouble into the life of his wife, Lauren Costigan. It's your task to help her.

When Bradley landed a spot behind bars, he was contacted by old acquaintances in the Tyger Claws. Shiv some snitches, they said. He said no.

Tygers don't like that word. They kidnapped his wife and sent stills as proof. No great surprise, Bradley began to cooperate. But he also remembered me. He's promised payment and I believe he's desperate enough to be good for it.

My people have already tracked where the stills were taken. Once you have the coordinates, set to work immediately.

objectives.description: Escort Lauren out of the building.

title: Gig: A Shrine Defiled
description:
Gig type: Agent Saboteur
Objective: Place a wiretap in a Tyger Claw-controlled shrine
Location: Shinto shrine at Milagro Terrace
Details:

The person should not stray from the road and the tiger should not leave his mountain steppes. Or misfortune will find them both.

Tyger Claw boss Taki Kazo thinks he's smart. He thinks I won't find out about his agreement at the shinto shrine on Milagro Terrace. He thinks I don't know he's using the shrine's honden for secret meetings. He thinks he can rule Japantown without my influence. He will be wrong.

I'll give you a wiretap to place right at the shintai in the most sacred of shinto spaces. Don't make a noise. And don't disappoint me.

objectives.description: Get out of the shrine complex.
Collect your bonus from the Drop Point.
Place the wiretap inside the shrine's main hall.

title: Gig: Wakako's Favorite
description:
Gig type: SOS: Merc Needed
Objective: Locate netrunner Chang-Hoon Nam, 67 years old, regular associate
Location: Restaurant on Crescent St.
Details:

For years, I worked to get jobs done comfortably, with a crew I hand-picked myself. I chose Chang-Hoon Nam years ago, and he hasn't let me down once. I don't know what happened to him, but you got to get him back. Check the basement in that Chinese place. He keeps his gear there, sometimes takes a side gig or two. Think he's still alive – if he weren't, he's the type who'd come back as a ghost and apologize, just like in those tales from the old country that make me want to puke. He's sentimental like that.

objectives.description: Find a way to Chang-Hoon Nam's hideout.
Find out what happened to Chang-Hoon Nam.
Find out what happened to Chang-Hoon Nam.
Slot the shard in Chang-Hoon Nam's neural port.
Find the shard for stabilizing Chang-Hoon Nam's condition.

title: Gig: Hothead
description:
Gig type: SOS: Merc Needed
Objective: Protect Walter Ozark
Location: Japantown
Details:

V, urgent job for you. A client just called about a problem with his head. Someone is in it.

Client's name is Walter Ozark, a corpo – didn't say where but it's an urgent request with good pay so I didn't ask. Like any mid-level manager, he was issued a memory backup implant. But Walter believes he has reason to suspect that it was laced with malware. In other words – he has someone listening in on his thoughts. Probably a rival colleague but – again – who cares.

Walter plans to reboot his implant but says as soon as tampering begins, the person responsible will receive a signal. If so, they could send someone to intervene. Walter's decided the safest strategy is to carry out the operation in a moving car to buy more time. I already have a runner willing to burn out the malware, but I need you behind the wheel. And remember – there's a reason why I hired you for this rather than a normal chauffeur. I'll send you the coordinates.

objectives.description: Drive to the indicated location to meet the netrunner.
Help Walter Ozark remove the tracing program.
Give the signal to netrunner when you're ready.

title: Gig: Greed Never Pays
description:
Gig type: Search and Recovery
Objective: Retrieve Leah Gladen's lockbreaker device
Location: Building on the corner of Holly and Floyd St, door code 2137
Details:

A great treasure can turn out to be a great curse. Remember that, V.

One of the fences in my territory, Leah Gladen, came into possession of some highly valuable equipment – a lockbreak device capable of jailbreaking corp cyberware (some call it a CorpCracker). This tech opens doors for suits who want out but don't want to lose function of corp-issued chrome or are looking to make an extra eddie by selling secondhand.

Leah wasn't born yesterday. She knows what the tech is worth. She and I went back and forth, long price negotiations. We were close to reaching a deal when all contact was lost.

Your job is to find out what happened to Leah – but more importantly to get that skeleton key for me. Don't bother reporting back until you have it. Don't waste time.

objectives.description: Go to Leah Gladen's apartment block.
Deposit the equipment at the Drop Point.
Go to the braindance club Wired Head.
Go to the braindance club Wired Head.

title: Professional Widow
description: The Westbrook gigs are all done and dusted. Wakako said she has something for you – wonder what it is? Another thinly veiled ex-husband threat-story, or something you can actually use? Guess we'll find out soon enough.

title: Cyberpsycho Sighting: The Wasteland
description: Does a cyclone of dust and sand stirred up by a dash cyberpsychosis sound exciting? Then I do I have some good news for you.

objectives.description: Read Regina's message in the cyberpsycho message thread.
Read the shard "Archived Conversation: Shiv4theWin and Raffen_Fever"
Search the area to collect information.
Use your scanner to find traces of the cyberpsycho.
Message Regina about Cyberpsycho Sighting: The Wasteland

title: Cyberpsycho Sighting: House on a Hill
description: Shots were heard on the outskirts of NC – rare given the seemingly peaceful area. We oughta go and take a closer look. Why wait for the clean-up crew when there could still be lives that need saving?

objectives.description: Read Regina's message in the cyberpsycho message thread.
Read the shard located on the cyberpsycho's body.
Read the shard located on the dead woman.
Search the area to collect information.
Message Regina about Cyberspycho Sighting: House on a Hill

title: Cyberpsycho Sighting: Second Chances
description: Everyone deserves a second chance, V. I know that better than most. But who's granting that chance and who's getting it are important questions that oughta be asked.

objectives.description: Read Regina's message in the cyberpsycho message thread.
Read the shard "I have seen the light".
Search the area to collect information.
Message Regina about Cyberpsycho Sighting: Second Chances

title: Cyberpsycho Sighting: On Deaf Ears
description: Hey V! Watch out. Whoever left those bodies is still hanging around.

objectives.description: Read Regina's message in the cyberpsycho message thread.
Read the shard "Archived Conversation: Maciej Nakonieczny and Cedric Muller"
Read the shard "Archived Conversation: Maciej Nakonieczny and Peter Novotny"
Search the area to collect information.
Message Regina about Cyberpsycho Sighting: On Deaf Ears

title: Cyberpsycho Sighting: Phantom of Night City
description: Ghosts? Ghosts don't exist, V. The dead can tell you that.

objectives.description: Read Regina's message in the cyberpsycho message thread.
Read the shard "Archived Conversation: Norio Akushitsuna and Dr. Colin Thevenaz"
Search the area to collect information.
Message Regina about Cyberpsycho Sighting: Phantom of Night City

title: Cyberpsycho Sighting: Seaside Cafe
description: Whoever killed them was packing a lot of hate, a lot of rage. And those feelings  don't fade quickly. Be careful.

objectives.description: Read Regina's message in the cyberpsycho message thread.
Read the "Saigon Sisters: Season Finale" script.
Read the shard "Message to Linh Hyunh".
Read the shard "Message to Dao Hyunh".
Search the area to collect information.
Message Regina about Cyberpsycho Sighting: Seaside Cafe.

title: Cyberpsycho Sighting: Letter of the Law
description: I have a bad feeling about this. A real bad feeling.

objectives.description: Read Regina's message in the cyberpsycho message thread.
Search the computer for more info.
Search the area to collect information.
Message Regina about Cyberpsycho Sighting: Letter of the Law

title: Cyberpsycho Sighting: Smoke on the Water
description: If it weren't for the all the screaming, dead Scavs and that wreck of a car, be a pretty nice place. But hey, that's life. Wanna go check it out, see what went down? Try the pier first.

objectives.description: Read Regina's message in the cyberpsycho message thread.
Find the cyberpsycho on the pier.
Read the shard titled "Archived Conversation: Hideyoshi Ueno and Ken Masuda."
Read the shard titled "Archived Conversation: Ken Masuda and Diego Ramirez."
Search the area to collect information.
Message Regina about Cyberpsycho Sighting: Smoke on the Water

title: Cyberpsycho Sighting: Lex Talionis
description: The underpass near GIM is like NC's Bermuda Triangle for the homeless. Sound like a piece of cake? In the heart of Pacifica, nothing ever is.\n\nEnter at your own risk.

objectives.description: Read Regina's message in the cyberpsycho message thread.
Search the computer for more info.
Search the area to collect information.
Message Regina about Cyberpsycho Sighting: Lex Talionis

title: Cyberpsycho Sighting: Under the Bridge
description: V, you don't have anywhere else to be? Only thing you'll stir up here is trouble. I'd beat it, but... you do you.

objectives.description: Read Regina's message in the cyberpsycho message thread.
Read the shard "Archived Conversation: Tamara Cosby and Tony Ludic".
Search the area to collect information.
Message Regina about Cyberpsycho Sighting: Under The Bridge

title: Cyberpsycho Sighting: Discount Doc
description: Working on a construction site has its perks: breeze on your face, sun on your shoulders, no creepy corpo smell and tangible results you can show off to the world. It's good, honest work. 'Course Night City's always got a way of fucking things up.

objectives.description: Read Regina's message in the cyberpsycho message thread.
Search the area to collect information.
Message Regina about Cyberpsycho Sighting: Discount Doc

title: Cyberpsycho Sighting: Demons of War
description: Usually, when a corpo gets his walking papers, he loses all his implants too. They dig those synth organs and cyber eyes right out of his body. But sometimes, the chrome's so far ingrown, it can't be removed safely. Even if someone really, really wants it...

objectives.description: Read Regina's message in the cyberpsycho message thread.
Read the shard by the cyberpsycho's body.
Investigate the area by the bridge.
Search the area to collect information.

title: Cyberpsycho Sighting: Lt. Mower
description: WARNING! CYBERPSYCHO DETECTED. MILITECH HAS LOCKED DOWN THE AREA. KEEP AWAY!

objectives.description: Read Regina's message in the cyberpsycho message thread.
Read the shard with the conversation between Dr. Martin Sypura and Lt. Mower.
Search the area to collect information.

title: Cyberpsycho Sighting: Ticket to the Major Leagues
description: Not all people cope the same way when those first symptoms of cyberpsychosis show up. Some throw themselves off a bridge. Others hand themselves over to the cops. And most of the rest try to self-treat with sedatives – as many as they can get their hands on. No matter the cost.

objectives.description: Read Regina's message in the cyberpsycho message thread.
Read the shard "Ticket to the Major Leagues"
Search the area to collect information.
Message Regina about Cyberpsycho Sighting: Ticket to the Major Leagues

title: Cyberpsycho Sighting: Where the Bodies Hit the Floor
description: There are few certainties in Night City… Super-sketch stomach-melting streetfood, politicians choked by corporate leashes and the echo of screams heard coming from the Totentanz club. Oh wait, and one more: if you step foot down the wrong alley, your head will probably roll out the other end.

objectives.description: Read Regina's message in the cyberpsycho message thread.
Read the shard "Archived Conversation: Brick and Ellis".
Read the shard "Archived Conversation: Hoof and Sanders".
Search the area to collect information.

title: Cyberpsycho Sighting: Bloody Ritual
description: Not everyone's made for Maelstrom. Some – surprise, surprise – don't take to well to having half their face chopped off. They start hearing voices, seeing and imagining things. Then, it's enough to get their hands on a gun, and... that recipe for disaster's ready to serve.

objectives.description: Read the shard found on Zaria.
Locate where the ritual took place.
Read the shard found on the dead Maelstromer.
Read Regina's message in the cyberpsycho message thread.
Search the area to collect information.
Message Regina about Cyberpsycho Sighting: Bloody Ritual

title: Cyberpsycho Sighting: Six Feet Under
description: Maelstrom certainly has its own unique recruitment and retention methods. Ranks getting too thin? Well, just kidnap a few Valentinos, knock 'em out cold and bolt on some new faceplates. What could possibly go wrong with that? Everything, that's what.

objectives.description: Read Regina's message in the cyberpsycho message thread.
Read the shard "Farewell" found on the attacker.
Search the area to collect information.
Message Regina about Cyberpsycho Sighting: Six Feet Under

title: Reported Crime: Comrade Red
description: Soviets in the American desert. If that doesn't sound like a good spy story to you, go swap those ears! And check out the stash they were writing about.

title: Reported Crime: Blood in the Air
description: Looks like this choomba wanted to climb the turbine to fix something. Militech didn't want him to. 1 determined person + 1 unhappy corp = 1 dead dude. Easy math.

title: Reported Crime: Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close
description: See, V? Not everyone finds a new best friend in the dump. That samurai's not waking up anytime soon.

title: Reported Crime: I Don't Like Sand
description: You know, there are some days when anything that can go wrong, will. Some days you burn your toast and forget your keys, other days... Militech comes and fucks you up for losing a car in a sandstorm.

objectives.description: Get the loot from the car.

title: Cyberpsycho Sighting: Second Chances
description: Living on the edge is great, until you start to slip. This guy's been sliding down that slippery slope for a while. And you know what the best part is? He thinks everyone around him's whacked.

title: Reported Crime: Delivery From Above
description: Looks like acid rain isn't the only thing falling out of the sky over Night City. Wonder who this netrunner worked for…

title: Cyberpsycho Sighting: On Deaf Ears
description: Hey V! Watch out. Whoever left those bodies is still hanging around.

title: Reported Crime: Turn Off the Tap
description: Seems Sandra was a bit of a partier, but lost her cash flow when she lost her job. See, V? Better not run the EDGE of financial solvency. So – how bout we check out the car she left in the corpo lot?

objectives.description: Go to the corporate parking lot.

title: Suspected Organized Crime Activity: Chapel
description: Funny ain't it? The Valentinos sport crosses, get tattoos of saints, pray day and night and still murder wholescale without cause. And this isn't their only apparent contradiction. Jesus preached for a life free of material wealth. But the 'Tinos, well… no one loves gold as much as them. They say it's a "votive offering" for the Virgin Mary. But hey, don't you sweat it – the Vatican won't be on your ass if you appropriate it.

title: Reported Crime: Smoking Kills
description: Smoking used to get a bad rap, but smokers can breathe easy this day and age. Lung cancer? Buy a new lung. Throat cancer? Again, buy a new throat. Male performance problems? Mr. Stud will turn that dangle upside down. Turns out, however, the addiction itself can still lead to death. If someone nasty's keeping track of where and when you step out for a cig, well... Maybe it was better to kick the habit after all.

title: Suspected Organized Crime Activity: Living the Big Life
description: !DUPLICATE

title: Reported Crime: Roadside Picnic
description: Her name was Nina. And she died alone, terrified. You'll fill in the rest of the story, V.

title: Suspected Organized Crime Activity: Wipe the Gonk, Take the Implants
description: They killed their own choom, just for a few implants. Fuckin' scavs.

title: Reported Crime: Honey, Where are You?
description: Looks like Night City punishes love, betrayal, or indifference. Maybe all three. What we can say is there's a dead guy with a car somewhere in town. A car full of eddies.

title: Reported Crime: Disloyal Employee
description: HR in Night City is brutal. I mean, just look how he left that exit interview! And the guy only stole tidbits of intel. Eh, well... No use crying over spilled milk. Wanna check out his stash? Let's see how much he managed to scrape together from his little side job.

title: Reported Crime: Ooh, Awkward
description: Ah, same old tune – you zero a random guy, turns out he's got friends in high places, now you've brought down loads of trouble on yourself. Just another day in Night City, right? Well, one gonk's idiocy is another man's car full of eds, isn't it?

title: Reported Crime: Supply Management
description: Another poor choom just trying to get by. All he wanted was to undercut the corps a little, make a few eds off a few boosters. Well, didn't do much for his health. Know what would give us a boost, though? A little peek at what he left behind.

title: LocKey39438
description: V, allow me to explain how shit works. 6th Street had a little, how shall we say, shake-up in management. The new boss doesn't like those who liked the old boss. That means a few unlucky bastards are fucked, and we've got a front-seat view.

title: Reported Crime: Welcome to Night City
description: Our Wraith dealer here chose the wrong market. He made, as they say, a deadly misstep. But now you can get something out of it, right V? Just check his stash.

objectives.description: Go to the garage on Manzanita St.

title: Reported Crime: A Stroke of Luck
description: The dead don't talk, but their money sure does. Check out the house on Mallagra. Mr. skunky scuba over here sure won't be needing those eddies anymore.

objectives.description: Reach the house on Mallagra Street.

title: Reported Crime: Justice Behind Bars
description: Looks like the prison guard was in 6th Street's pocket. Surprised? Me neither. But clearly something way bigger was being planned here. Wonder what went wrong.

title: LocKey42920
description: Desperate sons of bitches. How fucked do you gotta be to come to the Wraiths for help? Well, I guess we'll find out, won't we, V? Whaddaya think? Or maybe we never will.

title: Reported Crime: Protect and Serve
description: Well, well, well. This comp proves the gangoons are buying off cops right and left! We gotta do something! Like, say, grab that Tyger Claw scratch just sitting there, waiting for the police. No eddies, no corruption, right? Look at us, cleaning up these mean Night City streets.

title: Suspected Organized Crime Activity: Opposites Attract
description: It's not always easy groupin' actions into the "good" and "bad." Boundaries often get blurred, plus this city's moral compass has long been demagnetized. But at least everyone can agree on one thing: scavs don't deserve an ounce of mercy.

title: Reported Crime: Worldly Possessions
description: Say what you will, but you ever see a stiff, it's never a bad idea to do a little rummaging. People rarely die for no reason. There's usually a bone to pick that eventually gets picked. Take, for example, some gonk who's neck deep in debt. Maybe instead of payin' it off they decide to keep it safe someplace...

objectives.description: Go to the columbarium in North Oak to find R.J. Griffin's urn.

title: Reported Crime: Paranoia
description: The homeless in Night City are frequent descenders into madness – in part because they live in perpetual fear, poverty and hunger, but also due to seeing things that shouldn't be seen. The shard you just found... It could be the ravings of just another lunatic. Or perhaps something more...

title: Suspected Organized Crime Activity: Tygers by the Tail
description: Someone finally stood up to those Tyger assholes. Must've been some decent, honest people… not too bright, though. How'd they think this was gonna end? With them takin' down one of Night City's biggest gangs? It'll be a bloodbath, V. Well... unless someone intervenes.

title: Reported Crime: Dangerous Currents
description: Excise duty, audits, taxes, bribes, queues... If you want to transport something legally, you have to jump through a lot of hoops. So it shouldn't come as a surprise that many take shortcuts. Though as we all know, shortcuts can be dangerous...

title: Suspected Organized Crime Activity: Vice Control
description: Bastards. Cops are sending scavs after the homeless? Cause they're in some developer's way? C'mon, V. Show 'em there's still some level of basic decency in Night City.

title: Suspected Organized Crime Activity: Just Say No
description: No such thing as quality control, test trials or focus groups in a drug lab. Those drugs are hittin' the streets with no guarantee of what's in 'em or what they'll do the people who buy them. Sure, some dealers strive for quality to build a loyal client base. But the rest? They flood the city with tainted shit that'll melt your brain. Best to keep those labs to a minimum. But I wouldn't count on the cops to do anything about it...

title: Cyberpsycho Sighting: Where the Bodies Hit the Floor
description: There are few certainties in Night City… Super-sketch stomach-melting streetfood, politicians choked by corporate leashes and the echo of screams heard coming from the Totentanz club. Oh wait, and one more: if you step foot down the wrong alley, your head will probably roll out the other end.

title: Suspected Organized Crime Activity: No License, No Problem
description: Maelstromers need a good ripper like fish need water. They're chromed out to the point they need constant maintenance: one short-circ and zap! – total system failure. That's why they've got their grubby fingers dipped into all sorts of clinics. If anyone gets sparks flyin' outta their ass, they can stop in for a quick tune-up. Long story short, the fewer the clinics, the worse off it gets for Maelstrom's borgs. I say get to work.

title: Reported Crime: Dredged Up
description: Dark, damp and the stench is enough to make you add to the muck... But there's always something interesting down there. Know what this place is? You'll find out soon enough. But before you do, better check what's in that container, see what really went down here first.

title: Reported Crime: Needle in a Haystack
description: Thing about containers is, they're all the same. Usually not a problem, but... Well, now you got no idea which one's got the thing you want. And that's when the plot thickens.

title: Reported Crime: One Thing Led to Another
description: Ah, the irony. Those gangoons installed a gadget to track the cops... And now the cops can track them right back. Technology serves no man, it seems. Zero loyalty!

title: Reported Crime: Don't Forget the Parking Brake!
description: Parking on a hill? Don't forget the parking brake. Otherwise, your car might start rolling downhill... Along with that valuable cargo in the trunk.

title: Reported Crime: You Play with Fire...
description: Smell that, V? Another scorched runner. Wonder what he said right before he sizzled?

title: Reported Crime: Lost and Found
description: Dealer torn up by hungry junkies. It happens. So, what'll it be, V? Wanna see what they got in that stash of theirs? Might just get something outta this.

title: Reported Crime: Another Circle of Hell
description: Choom wanted to grab someone's data, got himself burned. Clear? BURNED. But seriously – it could be worth checking the coords from his gear. Chooms like him usually have some nice toys.

title: !DUPLICATE
description: What can I say, the Tygers are forcing people to work for them. Used like tools. Definitely nothing new for them, but that doesn't mean we should let it slide, right?

objectives.description: What's there to say – the Tygers are pushing these poor people into forced labor. Probably don't even see 'em as people to begin with. Not gonna let this slide… are we?

title: Reported Crime: Crash Test
description: OK, V, got a simple case here. Dude got skezzed on his own product and went for a ride about town. It's your lucky day. No sense waitin' around when his pad is beggin' to get cleaned out.

objectives.description: Go to the dealer's stash in Japantown.

title: Reported Crime: Table Scraps
description: Gotta have a permit to even pick through these rich assholes' sloppy seconds. Jalapeño Joe didn't, that's why he had to go. And who did him? Some fucking corpo buttlickers. Tellin' ya, the sooner we burn this city, the better.

title: Suspected Organized Crime Activity: Privacy Policy Violation
description: Might seem running's a work-from-home gig – but not always, obviously. Sometimes a runner's gotta get his hands dirty, go out in the field. Just this time, looks like someone else got their hands dirty zeroing our runner.

title: Courier outro
description: V has another courier job from Muamar - this time it is something bigger and more complex.

objectives.description: Decide what to do about police officer
Link to the car remote controler
Wait for the crew to enter the car
Wait for the crew to return with the score
Wait until remote link calibration is completed

title: Nazaré "Racer"
description: Hello, V. I have an Arch Nazaré's that is looking for a new owner – practically new. It onced belonged to a corpo who wanted to impress his minions... except he did not have the first clue about handling it. He braked a little too hard and launched himself into the air – skull smacked the pavement so forcefully that not even TT Platinum could save him. Thank God for idiots. So, are you ready to buy?

title: Quartz EC-L r275
description: Hi, V! Got a Quartz waiting to be checked out. Fine machine, well taken care of, polished to a shine. Bought it off a certain gentleman who was a little whacked when it came to his car, huffing and puffing in his garage day in, day out. Until, that is, his wife filed for divorce – the ride had to go to pay the legal fees. Lemme know if you're interested.

title: Apollo
description: I hope this message finds you well and in good graces. I am selling a motorcycle, and not just any kind – a Brennan Apollo. If you wish to be swifter than the thunderous smiting hand of our fickle Lord, go to the indicated coordinates and open your heart and wallet. I should mention that this is a one-time offer – it would be a sin to miss it.

title: Emperor 620 Ragnar
description: Beep beep! Got a Chevillon Emperor for sale. Won't deny it – hunk of metal's on the cheap side, bottom-shelf, but goddamn, the suspension on this thing's baby-smooth. Feels like you're riding on a cloud. And the seats! Fuck me, it's like you're getting a massage! Paint job's also so pretentious it's almost endearing. For what you're getting, this one's a bargain, trust me.

title: Thrax 388 Jefferson
description: "As they were walking along and talking together, suddenly a chariot of fire and horses of fire appeared." I have a theory that cars would please the Lord if He returned to our world – in particular, the tuned up Chevillon Thrax 388 Jefferson I have for sale. A car so mighty and majestic it almost makes you want to bow down to it. A great car destined for a great person. The question is, my dear V, are you worthy of it? Do some soul searching, check your balance and get back to me.

title: Outlaw
description: So this is kinda last minute, but I got a Herrera Outlaw for sale. Wouldn't wait too long on this – knowing folks around here, thing's a fucking thief-magnet. Probably only 1000 of them left in the world, no more than ten in all of NC, so we're talkin' 'bout a precious commodity. So chop chop, don't dawdle or I guarantee you'll be crying yourself to sleep for weeks to come.

title: Supron FS3
description: Hey hey, got a Mahir Supron I need to get rid of. Now, I know I shouldn't talk smack about my own stuff, but... jesus, what a pile of shit. It's like someone welded an old tub and dumpster together, then stuck it in a cardboard cutout and taped some wheels on it. Look, I know not everyone's got enough €$ to blow on an Aerondight, but if you need something cheap, and fast – this is it.

title: MaiMai P126
description: Hello, V. I have a Makigai MaiMai for sale. Aside from sounding like a fruity cocktail, it is a little small – but you, your guns and your groceries will fit right in. What more do you need?

title: Shion MZ2
description: Hey hey, there's a Mizutani Shion that's looking for a new home. Won't lie, might be a little beaten up. Previous chick who owned it liked to lead-foot the pedal, but the engine, suspension, brakes, everything that matters – all that's in preem condish. Rides like a pure dream. This baby's a classic, and a fast one at that – perfect for losing the 5-0. Oh, and the flooring might be a little stained. Coffee...? Blood? Hard to tell.

title: Shion "Coyote"
description: V, if you are planning on spending more time in the Badlands, I have just the car to suit your needs – an all-terrain Mizutani Shion. It might look like a fuel-guzzling beast, but it could drive over a field of nails and broken glass like freshly paved asphalt. It pains me to part with it, but such is the nomad's lot – we cannot get attached to anything.

title: Turbo-R 740
description: I have a Quadra Turbo for sale, parked at the attached coordinates. I suspect it will not stay available for long, since it is a good machine and there is no shortage of buyers. If life has taught me anything, it is to seize an opportunity as soon as it appears, for it might only appear once. You can think about that while you gather the money to pay.

title: Type-66 640 TS
description: Yo, got a Quadra 66 up for sale. Previous owner was a SoCal and 6th Street-4eva type who liked to slam the gas racing the streets at night... till he slammed right into a corpo. Yeeaaah, can't say that ended well for him. But don't worry, the fender and windshield are brand new and the ride's in preem shape - all it needs is a new owner ;)

title: Quadra Type-66 Avenger
description: V! I come bearing good news. Scratch that, preem news! Got a Quadra Avenger for sale. Now this one's a fucking beauty, lemme tell ya. The paintjob, the interior, the rumble of that engine! Lookin' at her gets me a little hard, and I'm not even ashamed to admit it. A person who wouldn't buy this (and I mean stat) would be lame as hell. Just sayin'.

title: Quadra Type-66 "Javelina"
description: Greetings, brother. Would you happen to be looking for a new car? The kind that won't choke on dust every time you go through a turnpike? If the answer is yes, then check the coordinates I attached. I have Quadra that my brother-in-law tuned up. When I say he's a perfectionist, I mean he checks five times before tightening every screw and polishes every inch of frame until it sparkles. You won't find better quality for your money. The truth is, every nomad wants a car like this, but few can afford it. I hope you're tempted by the offer, because I would rather sell to someone I know rather than a stranger.

title: Quadra Type-66 "Cthulhu"
description: !OBSOLETE

title: Rayfield Aerondight "Guinevere"
description: V! I have a great deal for you – a Rayfield Aerondight "Guinevere"! It belonged to the ambassador of Argentina... that is, until the country returned to martial law and the only thing waiting for him there was a noose, so he sold everything he could and fled the city. He didn't try to bargain with me – the sign of a smart man. I too would be smart if I were you and get your cash ready, because this is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity. The world ain't exactly teeming with these beauties. Everyone wants to be unique, stand out, be noticed – I know you do too. The Aerondight can make that happen.

title: Rayfield Caliburn
description: Yo yo, V. Got some eddies to burn? Maybe, I dunno, you'd consider buying a Caliburn? You heard right – A FUCKING CALIBURN! Beautiful machine, a downright work of art. If I could, I'd make love to this thing. Used to belong to Cytech's CEO, but the gonk sold it cuz apparently, and I quote, "Only poor people drive two-year old cars." Shit, I wish everyone could be poor by that definition. I just hope this Caliburn gets a loving owner, cuz she deserves it. If you're interested, lemme know.

title: Colby C125
description: Hey! Letting you know I got a reeeally nice Thorton Colby for sale. Belonged to some car-jacker from Memphis, a certain Nicholas, may he rest in peace. He'd klep the most expensive wheels for rich buyers – you know, Rayfields, Herreras – but for years he always drove this Colby. I'd tell you why, but you'll know for yourself the second you get behind the wheel.

title: Thorton Colby "Little Mule"
description: Hello, V. I have a "Little Mule" for sale – in other words a custom-tuned Thorton Colby. A techie friend of mine found it in a ditch outside of town – thought it was beyond repair. Nothing but rust, dust and a communal bathroom for rats, by the looks of it. But once he gave it a wash-down, banged it back into shape, swapped out the suspension and cranked up the engine... well, for riding around in the desert, you can't go wrong.

title: Thorton Colby CX410 Butte
description: Heyo, got a pickup truck for sale. Perfect for moving heavy equipment and maybe the occasional dead body. Interested? If that's a yes, then lemme give you some advice straight off the bat: nothing washes off blood better than warm water mixed 1:1 with vinegar. Course, car's gonna smell like a jar of pickles after, but that's not a crime as far as the NCPD's concerned.

objectives.description: Buy Vehicle: Thorton Colby CX410 Butte (€$25,000)

title: Galena G240
description: V, my favorite merc! I got a Galena I'm selling. Hasn't been driven much – guy who owned for the last ten years was paranoid as shit of going outside cuz he was afraid "they" would zero him – car sat unloved for all that time. But you can't escape fate, right? Stray lead caught him through his window. Moral of the story's that you gotta grab life by the fucking balls. So don't be no scrooge, whip out your credchip and buy this baby.

title: Thorton Galena "Gecko"
description: V, I have a "Gecko" for sale – the nomad take on a Galena. Solid machine, but I have to warn you, it's a little bare on the inside. By that I mean no cup holder, LED screen, tush-warmer or other gimmicks. That being said, on rough terrain this thing is smoother than looks give it credit – you'll be sailing over every dune and rocky slope. So if you're strapping yourself in for a longer haul, it will practically pay for itself.

title: Mackinaw MTL1
description: Hey, got a Mackinaw waiting to be sold – you'll find it at the attached coords. Watch out for turns, cuz this thing drives like a fucking boat. It's almost like it WANTS to crash into streetlamps and pedestrians. Oh, and it's also a real gas-guzzler. Still, it's worth it for the kicks.

title: Alvarado V4F 570 Delegate
description: Greetings, V. I have an Alvarado for sale in excellent condition, sitting in Rancho at the attached coordinates. I acquired it from a Valentino who had so many enemies he barely got out of town alive. Still, he managed to sell me everything he owned, including the car. You can tell it belonged to someone who was vain, glued to his earthly possessions... but I must say, the purr of the engine is like music to the ears. If you want it, just say the word – and make the transfer – and it will be yours.

title: Columbus V340-F Freight
description: Hey, there's a used Columbus parked at the market, waiting on a buyer. Belonged to a choom who used to move drugs around town, so you might hang up an air freshener or someting. I don't mind the exotic smells so much, but each to their own, right? Lemme know what you think.

title: Cortes V5000 Valor
description: Listen, V. I have a Cortes for sale. It once belonged to some trust-fund kid who got it for his birthday, except instead of driving it around he preferred to stay hooked up to porn BDs all day. Eventually the family disowned him, sold his car, and now here we are. So, you interested? Take a look and give me your answer soon.

title: Kusanagi CT-3X
description: V. In your line of work, one must be quick and punctual. Since you seem to struggle with both, I figured you could use a motorcycle. If you can have only one, let it be the best – the Yaiba Kusanagi. I happen to have one for sale. Buy it and you will not regret it.

title: Just Another Story
description: Looks like you're gettin' into the habit of "collecting" cars and bikes for Ol' Capitan. Say, V, ever hear the phrase: "There is no job too small"? What am I saying? 'Course you have. It's obviously the code you live by.

objectives.description: Deliver the vehicle to the indicated location.
Reach the target before it drives off.
Wait for the scan to finish.
Deliver the vehicle to El Capitan.
Deliver the vehicle before time expires.
Deliver within time limit and in good condition
Deliver the vehicle in good condition.

title: Push It to the Limit
description: Random car, random place and the usual suspect fixer. Chances are this is all exaaaactly what it looks like. But sure, could be worse. At least El Clowno always pays up.

objectives.description: Deliver the vehicle to the indicated location.
Deliver the vehicle to El Capitan.

title: Baby Let Me Take You
description: Muamar “El Capitan” Reyes wants to focus? On somethin’ important? Shit, what could be more important than a criminal enterprise dedicated to the art of grand theft auto on a massive scale? So many questions, V... and so few answers.

objectives.description: Meet El Capitan by the dam.
Deliver the vehicle to the garage.
Get onto the Arasaka cargo ship.
Meet with Daniels at the docks.
Find the Arasaka truck on the cargo ship.
